title.rendered: Car in a Bag

content.rendered: This personal transporter, brought to you by Japanese engineering company Cocoa Motors, is small enough to fit in your backpack! It tops out at 6 miles/hour and has a range of 7.5 miles when fully charged.

excerpt.rendered: This personal transporter, brought to you by Japanese engineering company Cocoa Motors, is small enough to fit in your backpack! It tops out at 6 miles/hour and has a range of 7.5 miles when fully charged.

category.name: Technology
category.description: It's the new millennium and technology is everywhere, even inside our cars. If you're a techie and love reading about the latest car gadgets or alternative fuels, we've got what you need in this little corner.

title.rendered: What It’s Like to Go Through a Car Wash with No Doors

content.rendered:
While most people like to wash their own car themselves, sometimes we all find ourselves pressed for time and need to hit up a quick automated wash.

Ever wondered what it’d be like if you left your windows down or had no doors as you made your way through the wash? Well wonder no more because these guys did just that!

title.rendered: Brutal Cyclist Crash into Car During Downhill Race

content.rendered: The Guardman’s Pass Tour of Utah recently took place this past summer and someone captured footage of this particularly rough corner and a crash that took place there. A number of team cars are traveling with the cyclists but as they’re all downshifting to proceed with the hill one cyclist doesn’t cut their speed quickly enough before the curve and winds up T-Boning a car and crumpling into the pavement! It’s a rough crash!

title.rendered: If You Think You Shouldn’t Drive Across a Flooded Road, Then You Shouldn’t Drive Across a Flooded Road

content.rendered: It’s always better to error on the side of caution! This truck driver leaned the hard way that if you feel like you won’t make it across a flooded street then you really should try risking it at all!

title.rendered: The Russian Shaman Might Be the Mightiest All Terrain Vehicle You’ve Ever Seen

content.rendered: The Shaman is a Russian built 8 Wheel Drive All-Terrain monster capable of tackling anything the outdoors can throw at it. Built by Avtoros, this 20 foot long, 10 feet tall and 8 feet wide behemoth might not look very agile but it’s surprisingly nimble. Just check out the video to see what we’re talking about!

title.rendered: Auto Reviewer Locks Himself Out of Moving Car

content.rendered:
This Russian car reviewer was taping himself when he made a very serious error. We don’t know why he decided to jump out of the car (ghost riding the whip?)

For whatever reasons he bails, he does so while claiming to get ready to make fun of the car then winds up locking himself outside of the car as it’s still moving!

title.rendered: This Poor, Doomed Mercedes Benz SLS AMG Dies an Awful Death

content.rendered: It’s pretty common to peek into a junkyard and find some typical rides getting demolished. No one hangs on to their Corolla for sentimental reasons. But a Mercedes SLS AMG? We don’t know why this poor Benz was sent to the chopping block but there’s something oddly satisfying about watching something so expensive get obliterated!

title.rendered: Crash Testing the New Aluminium Bodied Ford F-150

content.rendered: Just how safe is that new aluminum bodied F-150 going to be? If you’re curious at all we recommend checking out this video detailing how it reacts to every manner of impact that routinely occurs on the road. Given how you see the truck react to these impacts, do you feel like you’d trust aluminium?

title.rendered: Car Vs. Helicopter Drift Battle!

content.rendered:
Red Bull knows how to set up one damn epic race! This time they’ve paired up Felix Baumgartner in a Bolkov B0105 aerobatic helicopter against Polish drifting master Jakub Przygonski in a Toyota GT 86 with 1,000 HP.

They spend the whole “race” trying to see how tightly Felix can match the helicopter with the Toyota as it whips around this open track!

title.rendered: The Police Car of the Future

content.rendered: Back from CES 2013 we’re taking another look at this future police car. It’s a beautiful and beefed up Dodge Charger complete with enormous touch screens all over the dashboard connected to a PC in the trunk. There’s also a rugged keyboard set up so now more fumbling with a giant, bulky laptop. Even the backseat is more comfortable for those unfortunate enough to get arrested – they’ve got molds in the seats designed to make room for individuals that are handcuffed.

title.rendered: Don’t You Hate it When Runners do This?

content.rendered:
Runners typically get sidewalks to hang out on. That’s the deal. They get their sidewalks and drivers get the road. However, as Matt from The Smoking Tire realizes they can dangerously show up in the worst places.

He’s reviewing the new BMW M4 modified with DINAN’s “S1″ package when he comes across these idiots stretching in the open road!

title.rendered: Corvette Z06 Loses a Wheel on the Nurburgring and Takes a Hard Crash

content.rendered: The Nurburgring seems to claim the lives of more cars than compactors and repo men combined! This particularly nasty footage came just recently as someone witnessed this doomed Corvette Z06 lose a wheel while trying to overtake that Opel. Once the wheel came off at 90 mph the ‘vette didn’t stand a chance. It wrecks horribly but the driver getting out in disbelief at the end is proof that he was alright.

title.rendered: Don’t Drive into the Pit Lane like Brad Keselowski

content.rendered: Watch as Brad drives into the pit lane but obviously doesn’t pay much attention as he almost misses his stall AND manages to even hit a few crew members in the process! That one guy with the tire knew how to get out of the way with lightning reflex though so he deserves some credit!

title.rendered: This Prototype Tesla Charger is Pretty Damn Creepy

content.rendered: If you own a Tesla Model S you can possibly one day own this handy automated charger that’ll live in your garage and seek out your car’s charging port all on its own. The feature sounds pretty amazing but if you sit around to actually watch it work it might freak you out.

title.rendered: Can You Parallel Park a Ferrari Quickly with a Crowd Watching?

content.rendered:
People are torn on how they feel about parallel parking. For some it’s easy, just a few quick turns and you’re all set. Other though, well it confounds them.

Now lets say you’re driving a Ferrari, not just any Ferrari but the well known velvet “Furrari” and you have to parallel park in front of a crowd. You could pull the move off deftly and look like a boss or you could wind up trying to park over several minutes then come no where close to the curb like this guy.

title.rendered: Dodge Ram Bends in Half During Pull Contest and Still Wins the Contest!

content.rendered:
The next time somebody tries to tell you that Dodge doesn’t make a dependable truck just show them this video and drop the mic.

During the pull competition at the Big Lick event this past summer a Dodge Ram loaded down with so much weight in the front and in the bed took on a massive contender when it immediately bent in half! We’ve never seen a truck almost snap like a twig before. Even though it looked down for the count they were quickly able to bend it back into place where it competed again and turned even more heads by winning flat out!

title.rendered: Best of Mud Trucks Gone Wild

content.rendered: The Mud Trucks Gone Wild event is what you’d get if you combined a typical Girls Gone Wild video with a few days camped out for a massive mud trucking rally – so needless to say, it’s pretty damn awesome! Here are some of the best moments from events like these that always include trucks rescuing other trucks, tons of beer, plenty of 4X4s, women in bikinis and, in this case, stripper poles at night!

title.rendered: Lexus Made an Actual Working Hoverboard

content.rendered:
Remember in Back to the Future when Marty McFly has to grab a young girl’s hoverboard to escape from Biff’s gang? Well that “future” scene was supposed to be the year 2015. Now here we are in 2015 and Lexus has stepped up to the plate and created a real, honest to God hoverboard!

They’ve been teasing this beauty all month long and they’re finally unveiling it here! \

Check out this video showing an actual hoverboard in action!
